moves.1. e4 c5 2. c4 Nc6 3. d3 d6 4. Nc3 Nf6 5: Now that I have time to think I'm reviewing certain moves from this blitz game.  Possible 5...Bg4 what did I ever do with that LSB?  Took until move 19 to get it going and then it played an important role on the e6-b3 diagonal.  Better than ...Bg4 would have done.
moves.6. Be2 Be7 7. Bg5 O-O 8. O-O Nd7: Computer doesn't like this move but it's blitz and I'm looking at that N on the Q-side anyway.
moves.9. Bxe7 Qxe7 10. Qd2 Nb6 11. b3 Rd8: I keep preparing the central break.  He should do the same.  Actually, b4 or a4 would have also been good ideas for him I believe.
moves.12. Qe3 h6 13. Rad1 d5: I'm ready but computer doesn't like it.  I was thinking his last 2 moves were pretty defensive.
moves.14. exd5 exd5 15. cxd5 Qxe3 16. fxe3 Nxd: The position opened up as I thought but the moves were played very quick.  I'm sure he played 18.e4 for tempo but d4 would be better.  And really I should have responded ...Rd6 but my head started spinning so the simple ...Rd8 was played.
moves.18... Rd8 19. Ne1: Can only re-deploy to c2 but then where?  In the game he just returns it to f3 lol
moves.19... Be6: So that’s where my LSB ended up.  I was preparing for mobilization of my Q-side pawns.
Objectively better to activate pieces along open lines.
moves.24... Rc8 25. h3: He’s allowing me lots of time.
moves.25... Bd7: Wanted to move my b-pawn but can’t remember why?  ...Rc3 is great but no rush to play it.
moves.26. Rf2 b5 27. a4: He’s challenging me but I’m pretty strong over there.
moves.27... a6 28. axb5 axb5 29. Kh2: His poor R is just sitting there.
moves.29... Rc3: Now my R has strong purpose.
moves.30. Bc2 Be6: Or d3 because it gets captured on move 33 and it's a valuable passed pawn.
moves.31. Rd2 Bxb3 32. Bxb3 Rxb3 33. Rxd4 Ra3: Wrong.  Keep the R on the b-file.
moves.36. Kg3 Ke7 37. Kf4 Ke6: …Ra4 is much better...almost winning.  Pins the R!
moves.39. exf6 gxf6 40. Kd4 Kd6 41. Kc3 Kc5 42: Too quick.  Requires deep analysis though.  Computer really likes …Ra3+ but the obvious Kb2 needs a lot of thought to refute.
moves.46. Rf6 Ra5: No need.  Plus his K-side pawns are strong.
moves.47. Rc6+ Kd3: Not bad.  Check out …Kd4 and then what?
moves.50... Ra2+ 51. Kb1 Kc3: …Rxg2 was needed but I see what I was thinking…trying to promote the b-pawn.
moves.52. Rc6+ Kb4: I timed out.  He played well especially with almost 200 ELO difference.  He had 9 seconds left.
